group.name: Locks
group.description: Lock bits allowing to lock access to specified fuses

registers.name: LOCKS
registers.description: Fuse LOCKS

bitfields.name: TESTER_LOCK
bitfields.description: Perform lock on Tester programed fuses.

values.name: Unlock
values.description: Unlock (The controlled field can be read, sensed, burned or overridden in the corresponded IIM register)

values.name: Write Lock
values.description: Write Lock (The controlled field can be read or sensed only)

values.name: Operation Lock
values.description: Operation Lock (The controlled field can't be overridden)

bitfields.name: FIELD_RETURN
bitfields.description: Configure device for field return testing. Fuse burning is protected by CSF command, with proper parameter passed. Write / OP protected by FIELD_RETURN_LOCK bit in control register.

values.description: Device is in functional / secure mode.

registers.name: LOT_NO_ENC[42:11]
registers.description: NXP-wide unique, encoded LOT ID STD II/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

bitfields.name: LOT_NO_ENC[42:11]
bitfields.description: NXP-wide unique, encoded LOT ID STD II/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

registers.description: NXP-wide unique, encoded LOT ID STD II/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

bitfields.description: NXP-wide unique, encoded LOT ID STD II/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

bitfields.name: WAFER_NO[4:0]
bitfields.description: The wafer number of the wafer on which the device was fabricated/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

bitfields.name: DIE-Y-CORDINATE[7:0]
bitfields.description: The Y-coordinate of the die location on the wafer/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

bitfields.description: The X-coordinate of the die location on the wafer/SJC CHALLENGE/ Unique ID

registers.name: SI_REV[3:0]
registers.description: Fuse SI_REV[3:0]

registers.name: TESTER_CFG
registers.description: Fuse TESTER_CFG

bitfields.name: SEC_CONFIG[0]
bitfields.description: Security Configuration Mode, and block of debugging of security HW, by JTAG

bitfields.name: SPEED_GRADING[1:0]
bitfields.description: Burned by tester program, for indicating IC core speed

registers.name: BOOT_CFG0
registers.description: Fuse BOOT_CFG0

values.name: eMMC: Normal
values.description: 1000 - MMC/eMMC (SD/MMC Speed Normal, Fast Boot Acknowledge Disabled)

values.name: eMMC: Normal/FB
values.description: 1001 - MMC/eMMC (SD/MMC Speed Normal, Fast Boot Acknowledge Enabled)

values.name: eMMC: High
values.description: 1010 - MMC/eMMC (SD/MMC Speed High, Fast Boot Acknowledge Disabled)

values.name: eMMC: High/FB
values.description: 1011 - MMC/eMMC (SD/MMC Speed High, Fast Boot Acknowledge Enabled)

values.name: FlexSPI NAND 50MHz 12b
values.description: 1100 - FlexSPI (Serial NAND), Default safe communication frequency High Speed (50 MHz), column address width 12bits

values.name: FlexSPI NAND 30MHz 13b
values.description: 1101 - FlexSPI (Serial NAND), Default safe communication frequency Low Speed (30 MHz), column address width 13bits

values.name: FlexSPI NAND 50MHz 12b 1
values.description: 1110 - FlexSPI (Serial NAND), Default safe communication frequency High Speed (50 MHz), column address width 12bits

values.name: FlexSPI NAND 30MHz 13b 1
values.description: 1111 - FlexSPI (Serial NAND), Default safe communication frequency Low Speed (30 MHz), column address width 13bits

bitfields.name: BOOT_CFG2
bitfields.description: BOOT configuration register #2, Usage varies, depending on selected boot device.

registers.name: BOOT_CFG1
registers.description: Fuse BOOT_CFG1

values.name: Open
values.description: Open (allows any program image, even if the authentication fails)

values.name: Closed
values.description: Closed (The program image executes only if authenticated)

bitfields.name: Boot Frequencies
bitfields.description: Determines, ARM Core and Bus frequencies during boot

values.description: Direct boot from external memory is allowed
Direct boot from external memory is not allowed

bitfields.name: BT_FUSE_SEL
bitfields.description: Determines, whether using fuses for boot configuration, or GPIO /Serial loader

bitfields.name: FORCE_COLD_BOOT
bitfields.description: Force cold boot when A9 core come out of reset. Reflected in SBMR reg of SRC

values.description: Default behavior equivalent to the rest of the i.MX6 family allowing a fast recovery from low power modes.  That is, the ROM is allowed to jump to the address previously programmed in the SRC persistent register.
Fast recovery path in the ROM is not allowed and a cold boot is always performed.  Customers wanting a higher level of security should burn this fuse.

bitfields.name: FORCE_INTERNAL_BOOT
bitfields.description: Once been blown, the external BT_MODE[1:0] pins will be ignored, BootROM will take Boot Mode as “internal boot”.

values.description: BT_MODE pins be ignored,  Boot Mode forced to "internal boot"

bitfields.name: DAP_SJC_SWD_SEL
bitfields.description: Control DAP works in JTAG or SWD mode

bitfields.name: SJC_DISABLE
bitfields.description: Disable/Enable the Secure JTAG Controller module. This fuse is used to create highest JTAG security level, where JTAG is totally blocked.

bitfields.name: JTAG_SMODE[1:0]
bitfields.description: JTAG Security Mode. Controls the security mode of the JTAG debug interface

bitfields.name: DLL_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Controls the enable/disable of the DLL for SD/eMMC boot

bitfields.name: NAND_ECC_DISABLE
bitfields.description: Indicate whether to enabled ECC (done by SW/Device HW) for Raw Nand device

bitfields.name: KTE
bitfields.description: Kill Trace Enable. Enables tracing capability on ETM, and other modules

values.description: Bus tracing is allowed in case security state as defined by Secure JTAG allows it (for example, JTAG_ENABLE or NO_DEBUG)

bitfields.name: JTAG_HEO
bitfields.description: JTAG HAB Enable Override. Disallows HAB JTAG enabling. The HAB may normally enable JTAG debugging by means of the HAB_JDE-bit in the OCOTP  SCS register. The JTAG_HEO-bit can override this behavior

values.description: HAB may enable JTAG debug access
HAB JTAG enable is overridden (HAB may not enable JTAG debug access)

registers.name: BOOT_CFG2
registers.description: Fuse BOOT_CFG2

bitfields.name: Override SD Pad Settings
bitfields.description: Overrides ROM default value for SD PAD control register. When set ROM will override SD pad control register with value programmed into PAD_SETTINGS fuse bits.

bitfields.name: BT_MPU_DISABLE
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to not enable MMU

bitfields.name: L1 I-Cache DISABLE
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to not enable L1 I-Cache

values.name: Enable
values.description: L1 I-Cache is enabled during boot

values.name: Disable
values.description: L1 I-Cache is disabled during boot

bitfields.name: Disable SDMMC Manufacture mode
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used to disable ROM feature “SD/MMC Manufacturing Mode”.

bitfields.name: SD2 VOLTAGE SELECTION
bitfields.description: Fuse bit to change voltage selection for SD2 pads. When set ROM will select 1.8V for SD3 pads otherwise 3.3V

bitfields.name: DLL Override
bitfields.description: Select the DLL mode for SD/eMMC.

bitfields.name: USDHC IOMUX SRE Enable
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to enable SRE bit for SD pads

bitfields.name: USDHC_IOMUX_SION_BIT_ENABLE
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to enable SION bit  for MUX control register.

bitfields.name: ENABLE_EMMC_22K_PULLUP
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to enable 22K pullup for SD pads.

bitfields.name: USDHC_PAD_PULL_DOWN
bitfields.description: The fuse bit is used for ROM to enable pull down bit for SD pads.

bitfields.name: Override HYS bit for SD/MMC pads
bitfields.description: Once this fuse be blown, the [HYS] bit of  IOMUXC_SW_PAD_CTL_PAD_SDx_CLK(x is the SD port which the ROM boot from), IOMUXC_SW_PAD_CTL_PAD_SDx_CMD, IOMUXC_SW_PAD_CTL_PAD_SDx_DAT0-n(n will be 0, 3, or 7, depends on the bus width selected) will be set.

bitfields.name: eMMC 4.4 - RESET TO PRE-IDLE STATE
bitfields.description:
Once this fuse be blown, the CMD0 with argument 0xf0f0f0f0 will be sent to put the eMMC card into pre-IDLE state so that eMMC card’s fast boot can work properly.
This is useful for the warm boot, such as boot due to the WDOG reset.

bitfields.name: BT_LPB_POLARITY
bitfields.description: Define GPIO3 polarity, for determining LPB boot mode.

bitfields.name: LPB_BOOT
bitfields.description: Divide (Core / Bus) based on Boot Frequencies

bitfields.name: MMC_DLL_DLY[6:0]
bitfields.description: eMMC 4.4 delay line default value (set by boot rom), used in conjunction with "DLL Override" = 1 (BOOT_CFG3[3])

bitfields.name: Override NAND Pad Settings
bitfields.description: Override pad settings for NAND boot.

registers.name: MISC_CONF0
registers.description: Fuse MISC_CONF0

bitfields.name: PAD_SETTINGS
bitfields.description:
Used with conjuction of MMC/SD/Nand "Override Pad Settings" fuse value, as follow:
'0' - Use IO default settings for boot device IO pads.
'1' - Use "Override" value, as set by this register.

bitfields.name: USB_VBUS_EVENT_HANDLER_EN
bitfields.description: Rom handle USB VBUS attach/detach event

values.description: ROM not handle USB VBUS attach/detach event
ROM handle USB VBUS attach/detach event
don't use read retry(RR) sequence embedded in ROM
